intro: Matelea fontellana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are woody and branched. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance, enhancing its role in nighttime ecological interactions.
